intro: Epallage boinensis, commonly known as the slender epallage, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes plants known for their ornamental and ecological significance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its unique appearance and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
